pull.title: bugfix: throw an error if an invalid parameter is passed to getnetworkhashps RPC
pull.body:
When writing some scripts that iterated over many blocks to generate hashrate estimates I realized that my script was going out of range of the current chain tip height but was not encountering any errors.

I believe that passing an invalid block height to this function but receiving the hashrate estimate for the chain tip instead should be considered unexpected behavior.

rename.to: bugfix: throw an error if an invalid block height is passed to getnetworkhashps RPC

events.body: Seems fine to do this. Not sure if a release note is needed, because strictly speaking this could be a breaking change.

I would prefer [6074de6](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28554/commits/6074de667c4bd66359532fbde6e025ff0e37241f) and [786ba64](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28554/commits/786ba64057ca48a51ec8c7307eccfbaa7918c981) be squashed together in one commit

utACK

nit: Remove `pb == nullptr` check below, as it is no longer possible.

verification.payload:
tree 8fa680facb1d5fb65a01fe267bfb382cf8cb3fd7
parent 5bbf735defac20f58133bea95226e13a5d8209bc
author Jameson Lopp <jameson.lopp@gmail.com> 1696100796 -0400
committer Jameson Lopp <jameson.lopp@gmail.com> 1696337571 -0400

Throw error if invalid parameters passed to getnetworkhashps RPC endpoint

events.message: Throw error if invalid parameters passed to getnetworkhashps RPC endpoint

events.body: Upon further inspection I realized that the "lookup" nblocks parameter also had insufficient validation so I've added checks to ensure that it's either a positive number or -1.

rename.from: bugfix: throw an error if an invalid block height is passed to getnetworkhashps RPC
rename.to: bugfix: throw an error if an invalid parameter is passed to getnetworkhashps RPC

+            textwrap.dedent("Block does not exist at specified height").strip(),
+            lambda: self.nodes[0].getnetworkhashps(100, 99999999),
comments.body: instead of using the hardcoded `99999999` we can use `self.nodes[0].getblockcount() + 1` which might be better

Maybe also remove the `&& height < active_chain.Height()` check as well, then?
